body.p:
August 31 1865
Morgantown Butler Co Ky.
Thos E. Bramlette
Governer of Ky

On the 12th day of April last one James M Bryant in a drinking spree on a difference about $500 sudenly picked up a Stone & Killed Capt John J -- Washer and made his escape. We have made $100 -- to pay for his arrest as we believe we have heard of his whereabouts and desire if you think proper that you would offer a like amount. Capt Washer was as peaceable inoffensive & harmless as any man & Supported a good character. He served gallantly as Capt in the 11 Ky Vol In. throughout truly brave & loyal his only fault was sometimes drinking too much. Bryant was a disapated gambler

Verry Respectfully
John C Cohron
Admir of Capt John J Washer

I think it would be right & proper to offer the reward as Washer was a good citizen and the Statements of John C Cohron are
to be relied on

Yours &c
B L D Guffy P J B C C

Butler Co
Reward
$200 -- for J. M Bryant
offered 9 Sept/65.
